content: $SPCE this guy 🙄

@M_W_T totally different industries. A submarine sinking has absolutely zero to do with space tourism. Also totally different customer profiles. There is no overlap between the two customer bases. The success of $SPCE comes down to the ability to execute their business strategy, conduct successful launches and overall demand for space tourism which is building (with 800 flights booked and paid for equalling $370M in revenue). Virgin Galactic is also the only space tourism player in the market with FAA approval for launches.. with multiple  launches upcoming. Ready for launch! 🚀🍻🚀🍻🚀🍻🚀

$SPCE @M_W_T this is hands down the most idiotic argument I've ever seen in my entire life. WTF does a submarine accident have to do with a space launch? Nothing. By this logic, the fact that horses died at Churchill Downs is a reason NASCAR will fail. I tried to start a conversation with you about this, but of course you start a new thread like a jackass because you can't handle a real debate. You're just posting BS trying to tank the stock

@howardlindzon @M_W_T what does a submarine accident have to do with a space launch? Nothing. 

People are way too bearish on $SPCE stock. The IP alone (technology, patents) is worth 4x the current stock price. Virgin Galactic has sold 800 tickets to space which works out to $370M. They also have Mach 3 jet in development that will take passengers from NY to London in 90 min. If nothing else, this is a great swing trade. I've already booked 5k in profits on call options since Fri.

$NVDA and AI bears might actually be the stupidest in the history of the stock market. ChatGPT is already the fastest adoption curve in human history with adoption growing exponentially. 100m users adopted in less than 2 months. Will easily shatter the fastest ever to 1B daily active users next year. AI market is growing 120% YoY with more catalysts than we can count coming up

@TimeTRAVELER101 $NVDA is growing faster than any company on the plant rn. Literally startups are having their VC firms acquire AI chips for them bc there's a bidding war to buy. 

Nvidia would among the largest cash positions of any company outside of Apple Microsoft Google if they sold shares. A major stock sale by the company is likely the only thing that'll make this dip significantly.. but my guess is they'll run up the price and announce a stock split at the end of summer.

That said, they are lagging competitors on AI among other sectors. My guess is AMD and Nvidia have 5-8x the growth of Intel in next 3 years

@ash321123 @brossmountain TSM is a safer bet. Nvidia uses them as the foundry to manufacture all of its AI chips. TSM and AMD are leading on chip design. Order volume for AI chips is massive. Nvidia has a healthy lead rn. I also like $AMD.

$U here come the upgrades. ;-) 
"Assuming that Unity Software can reach consensus estimates of around 19% forward revenue growth, my estimate for 30% net margins over the long term, and trade at a 1.5x price to earnings growth ratio ('PEG ratio'), I could see U trading at 8.6x sales or around $53 per share over the next 12 months. If U can return to the 30% growth rate, a level that management has previously stated as being a sustainable medium term growth rate (but has declined to reiterate over the past two earnings calls), then the projected upside increases to as high as $84 per share."

"We know there is a community of developers who have been building incredible 3D apps for years," Susan Prescott, Apple's vice president of worldwide developer relations, said during Apple's keynote. @FiskerRedemption @jeffgosia6 @firehawk1776 the biggest issue is Fisker's liquidity. Rivian just reported $11.78B in cash, 3x the amount $LCID has ($3.4B) and 19x the amount Fisker has ($652M).

Lucid expects its cash to last until Q3 2024.. given the slowdown in production and deliveries. Fisker is more cash efficient but is lagging everyone else in the field rn which makes me think they're going to have to raise funds by EoY.

With $500M+ in revenue per quarter, Rivian and Polestar are the best EV startup picks "by the numbers" to survive into 2025. 

I'm not saying that's what's going to happen. I love Fisker, the car and design, but I'm pretty worried. I'm likely going to buy a put to protect my downside risk.
